metadata.Title: CVE-2015-3146 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The (1) SSH_MSG_NEWKEYS and (2) SSH_MSG_KEXDH_REPLY packet handlers in package_cb.c in libssh before 0.6.5 do not properly validate state, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and crash) via a crafted SSH packet.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3146` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssh-4 - 0.6.1-0ubuntu3.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libssh package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.6.1-0ubuntu3.3').
